verses.roman:
āhūya dūra-gā yadvat
kṛṣṇas tam anuvartatīm
veṇuṁ kvaṇantīṁ krīḍantīm
anyāḥ śaṁsanti sādhv iti

synonyms: āhūya—calling; dūra—who were far away; gāḥ—the cows; yadvat—just as; kṛṣṇaḥ—Kṛṣṇa; tam—him; anuvartatīm—one gopī who was imitating; veṇum—the flute; kvaṇantīm—vibrating; krīḍantīm—playing games; anyāḥ—the other gopīs; śaṁsanti—praised; sādhu iti—"excellent!"
translation: When one gopī perfectly imitated how Kṛṣṇa would call the cows who had wandered far away, how He would play His flute and how He would engage in various sports, the others congratulated her with exclamations of "Well done! Well done!"
